dt: {bc}an inference {dx_def}see {dxt|inference||1}{/dx_def} that does not follow from the premises {dx_def}see {dxt|premise:1||1}{/dx_def}

{bc}a fallacy resulting from a simple conversion of a universal affirmative {dx_def}see {dxt|affirmative:1||3}{/dx_def} proposition or from the transposition of a condition and its consequent {dx_def}see {dxt|consequent:1||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}a statement (such as a response) that does not follow logically from or is not clearly related to anything previously said

dt.t: We were talking about the new restaurant when she threw in some {it}non sequitur{/it} about her dog.

shortdef: an inference that does not follow from the premises; specifically : a fallacy resulting from a simple conversion of a universal affirmative proposition or from the transposition of a condition and its consequent
a statement (such as a response) that does not follow logically from or is not clearly related to anything previously said
